image.altText: The exterior of a suburban shopping centre with a sign for Woolworths

props.synopsis: NT Police have arrested a 38-year-old man who allegedly swung an axe at members of the public and injured a police officer in an incident at the Karama Shopping Plaza.

title.children: Man allegedly threatens Darwin shoppers with axe, injures police officer

image.altText: Annmarie Lumsden looks across the camera against a dark blue background.

props.synopsis: With a team of four lawyers managing a caseload of almost 500 files, Legal Aid NT says crime teams in Alice Springs are struggling under the strain of a lawyer shortage, after NAAJA's decision to stop taking on new criminal matters.

title.children: Legal Aid NT says some defendants will face Alice Springs court unrepresented amid lawyer shortage

image.altText: Buffel grass grows high east of Alice Springs

props.synopsis: Huge bushfires in central Australia have ignited discussions about the role of buffel grass in increasing fire risks ahead of a recommendation on whether or not the plant should be declared a weed in the Northern Territory.

title.children: Bushfires in central Australia fuel debate about whether buffel grass or native grasses burn more intensely

image.altText: A middle-aged blonde woman speaks into a microphone in front of a dark, wood-panelled wall.

props.synopsis: Optus boss Kelly Bayer Rosmarin tells a Senate inquiry that 228 triple-0 calls were unable to be made during last week's outage, while the Australian share market falls slightly after Wall Street's recent rally comes to an end. Follow live.

title.children: Optus CEO tells Senate inquiry she has no plans to resign, has not had time to 'think about myself'

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: RBA appoints former Turnbull staffer as Chief Communications Officer
That's it for the Optus outage inquiry in the Senate today
Final questions on small businesses and Optus company culture

image.altText: Sergeant Jason Doig shot in the line of duty

props.synopsis: The policeman killed in the line of duty in regional South Australia overnight has been named as Brevet Sergeant Jason Doig, a "highly respected" and experienced officer whose death has devastated the force.

title.children: Police officer shot dead, two people with gunshot wounds after incident on regional SA property

image.altText: Travis Head celebrates with Pat Cummins and Josh Inglis.

props.synopsis: Australia will face India in Sunday's Cricket World Cup final after Travis Head's brilliance secured a thrilling three-wicket victory over South Africa in a memorable semifinal.

title.children: South Africa choke again in World Cup semifinals as Travis Head inspires Australia with bat and ball in Kolkata

image.altText: Anthony Albanese, wearing a suit, stands in front of a Qantas plane, with the logo visible.

props.synopsis: Prime Minister Anthony Albanese has been under attack from the Coalition and some sections of the media since he took office for the number of international trips he has taken. But how does he compare to other recent prime ministers?

title.children: How does Anthony Albanese's international travel stack up against other recent prime ministers?

image.altText: A woman's headshot

props.synopsis: Queensland University of Technology's vice-chancellor says the institution will move towards "inclusive suitability" rather than merit because "the workforce needs to reflect the students coming through".

title.children: This university won't be hiring based on 'merit' anymore — here's why

image.altText: Chief Minister Natasha Fyles standing at a lectern and speaking into microphones, in a room and in front of several flags.

props.synopsis: Natasha Fyles says she has not done anything wrong, as her ownership of 169 shares in gas company Woodside attracted scrutiny from a federal senator earlier this week.

title.children: NT chief minister divests her Woodside shares to avoid 'a distraction'

image.altText: An arrangement of stones and sticks on a mound of sand on a beach

props.synopsis: Police will travel to a remote West Australian island where shocked boat skippers found what they believe are recent burial sites, raising questions about the number of people who are dying unrecorded in Australian waters.

title.children: 'It was super eerie': Suspected human graves on WA island spark offshore mystery

image.altText: A man in a backpack holds hands with a woman while walking out of a courthouse

props.synopsis: A Southport District Court jury returned its verdict this morning, acquitting Connor Buhk following a four-day trial.

title.children: Lifesaver found not guilty of rape at Gold Coast surf club

image.altText: Two young boys stand at the entrance of a makeshift tent in a camp

props.synopsis: Leaflets are dropped into the towns of Bani Shubaila, Khuza'a, Abasan and al-Qarara in the eastern part of Khan Younis, the south's main city, telling civilians to head towards the nearest known shelter. Follow live.

title.children: Netanyahu speaks to US media as Israel tells civilians in southern Gaza to evacuate

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: 'Not successful': Netanyahu on trying to get Gazan civilians out of harm's way
Gaza's last telecommunication provider shuts down
Negotiations underway to evacuate premature babies from Al-Shifa hospital: WHO

image.altText: An aerial view of a 4WD on a dirt road in remote Arnhem Land.

props.synopsis: The NT government is in talks with the Commonwealth in a bid to shield its roads from a national funding shake-up that would see it need to pay millions of dollars more per year for road projects.

title.children: NT government trying to secure exemption for federal road deal that would see 50/50 funding split

image.altText: A man stands wearing a palestinian scarf, therer are signs behind him and parliament house is shown in the background.

props.synopsis: During the past six weeks, protests have been gaining momentum with a growing number of activists camping out and staging hunger strikes to end the bloodshed in the Israel-Gaza war.

title.children: 'I'll come every single day': Uncle Ihab has stood outside Parliament for 12 hours every day of the Israel-Gaza war

image.altText: Gunbalanya

props.synopsis: The Northern Territory government defends a change in remote rent policy that public housing tenants from Gunbalanya say is an "unreasonable" and "unfair" system.

title.children: Public housing tenants challenge NT government's remote rent policy in Supreme Court

image.altText: A man stands next to a fire truck

props.synopsis: A 75-year-old life-long volunteer firefighter who died while battling a bushfire burning in the New South Wales north-west has been remembered as a "committed life member" of the Rural Fire Service.

title.children: Captain Leo Fransen identified as volunteer firefighter who died while battling NSW blaze

image.altText: A black and white photograph of the North Sydney Olympic Pool next to the Sydney Harbour Bridge.

props.synopsis: Between 1939 and 1996 the government hired dozens of photographers to document Australian life. Now many of their works of intimate nature photography, striking architectural shots and captured everyday memories are displayed in a new exhibition.

title.children: Eighty years ago, the government hired photographers to capture a slice of everyday life. Here's what they produced

image.altText: An elderly couple in formal black attire smile as they pose for a photo.

props.synopsis: A jury has convicted the man who broke into former US house speaker Nancy Pelosi's San Francisco home after he held her hostage and attacked her husband with a hammer.

title.children: Man who attacked Nancy Pelosi's husband with a hammer convicted of attempted kidnapping and assault

image.altText: Portrait of a billabong with gum trees overhanging the water

props.synopsis: As green energy players are going to greater lengths in a bid to secure support, the French company behind South Australia's massive Goyder renewables project has handed over the nearby Worlds End Gorge as a new SA national park.

title.children: Green energy giant gifts ‘hidden gem’ for national park as transition worries pile up

image.altText: GettyImages-1492108235

props.synopsis: Exercise is important, whether you like it or not. But enjoyment can help you stay consistent, and boost the benefits you get from a workout.

title.children: Forcing yourself to exercise? There may be better ways to boost motivation

image.altText: Almost half of shoplifting offences happen at self-serve checkouts.

props.synopsis: A supermarket chain in the UK has gone against the trend of self-service check-outs, saying they cannot provide great customer service "through a robot". So, could it happen in Australia?

title.children: 'Not great fans': UK supermarket chain ditches self-service check-outs in favour of real people

image.altText: A silver F1 car, at night, on the Las Vegas Strip, driving for specators

props.synopsis: The penultimate weekend of the season will be contested around the streets of Las Vegas, the first time the new street circuit will be used.

title.children: F1 dives into the unknown as The Strip challenges the world's best drivers

image.altText: optus 'yes' sign on glass fronted office block

props.synopsis: A Melbourne woman says she was in "an almost panic-attack state" trying to get in touch with Optus after the telco signed up a new customer with her mobile number.

title.children: Optus causes alarm by signing up a customer with an already active mobile number

image.altText: A woman with a pregnant belly lies down while a technician does an ultrasound

props.synopsis: Vaginal birth after a previous caesarean shouldn't be a battle, but making it happen in Australia can be exhausting for some expectant parents.

title.children: The battle to have a vaginal birth after a caesarean delivery in Australia

image.altText: a woman with red hair wearing a pink jumper.

props.synopsis: More than 20 per cent of businesses across Australia currently have at least one job vacancy, but experts say excellent candidates are often overlooked.

title.children: Recruitment bias shutting diverse candidates with 'huge value' out of jobs, experts say

image.altText: Glittery high heel boots

props.synopsis: More than 1,000 signatures have been added to call for a strip club to be stopped from opening in the heart of Albury. But its would-be proprietor says the town "really needs one".

title.children: Sex worker advocate says everyone deserves safe place as town fires up over strip club

image.altText: Police diverting traffic

props.synopsis: Investigators say a man in his 30s was found on the road early this morning with what appeared to be a gunshot wound to his neck.

title.children: Police believe fatal shooting in Rockhampton was targeted

image.altText: a soldier looks out at the port of gaza allegedly

props.synopsis: Video published by the IDF shows what it says is soldiers engaging in combat with Hamas militants in the port of Gaza.

title.children: Israeli Army says troops have taken 'operational control' of Gaza port

image.altText: Shipping cranes in background, DP World sign saying truck entrance only

props.synopsis: DP World, the port operator hit by a recent cyber attack, was vulnerable to an exploit that has been causing global havoc since July, according to multiple cybersecurity analysts.

title.children: Port operator hit by cyber attack had 'critical' vulnerability in IT systems

image.altText: A woman lying on the floor with her twin baby girls on either side

props.synopsis: After seven years trying for a family, Marni Cochrane was more than halfway through her first pregnancy with identical twin girls when they were diagnosed with a rare and potentially life-threatening medical condition.

title.children: After her mother died, Marni received 'devastating' news about her unborn twins. Now they 'amaze her every day'

image.altText: Giles gestures with one hand as he speaks at the despatch box.

props.synopsis: The High Court isn’t usually front and centre in politics. But when it is, it can land sharp punches that throw governments off balance.

title.children: A government in a big hurry gives opposition some wins on ex-detainees

image.altText: A teenage boy wearing a white shirt and navy tie with his arm around his mum with short dark hair.

props.synopsis: The night before her 19-year-old son's funeral, Rachelle Van der Loos's brother also took his own life. She has founded a charity that she hopes will spare others the loneliness she felt during that traumatic time.

title.children: Mum who lost son and brother 10 days apart founds mental health charity
